alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 2:57PM MST until January 17 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous wind chills of 30 to 40 degrees below zero. Areas of blowing and drifting snow likely. * WHERE...Much of southeast Wyoming along and southwest of a line from Casper to Wheatland to Pine Bluffs. * WHEN...Wind Chill Warning until 11 AM MST Tuesday. Winter Weather Advisory from 11 PM MST this evening until 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions due to significant blowing and drifting snow. Visibilities may be reduced to one half mile or less at times. Near-blizzard conditions are possible. Dangerous wind chills may cause frostbite on exposed skin as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Upper North Platte River Basin
